page.title: 03ST STEPHENS CHURCH
page.content: {St Stephens church }has a large, interesting graveyard. {St Stephens {church}is an old church as it was built in 948 A.D., the same year as two other churches in the area. You can tell it has passed through Roman and Norman times because it has both rounded and pointed arches. All the windows now have thick plastic covering to prevent damage by vandals. The church has a large and interesting graveyard and includes the grave of the wife of Sir Mortimer Wheeler. Mortimer Wheeler was responsible for most of the Verulamium excavations and the grave is covered by Roman tiles. The church used to have a brass lectern in the shape of an eagle but it was stolen on St Andrews Day, 1984, possibly by some{Scots}as the lectern came from Scotland originally.
